statement:
Let $A\subset {\ensuremath{{\mathbb{Z}}}}_p$ be a set of residues modulo
$p$, and let $h$ be a positive integer, then
$$h^\wedge\!A=\{\,a_1+a_2+\dotsb+a_h \mid a_1,a_2,\dotsc,a_h\text{ are distinct elements of }A\,\}$$
has cardinality at least $\min(p,hk-h^2+1)$. This was conjectured by
Erdős and Heilbronn in 1964[@cite:erdos_heilbronn_conj]. The first proof
was given by Dias da Silva and Hamidoune in 1994.

Paul Erd[ő]{}s and Hans Heilbronn. On the addition of residue classes
$\mod p$. , 9:149–159, 1964. .
